benchmark_details.name: RTL-Breaker
benchmark_details.overview: RTL-Breaker provides a novel framework to assess the security of large language models (LLMs) against backdoor attacks in the context of HDL code generation, by analyzing various trigger mechanisms and their effectiveness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and analyze backdoor attacks on LLMs generating HDL code and foster research on countermeasures.

data.source: A dataset of HDL codes was sourced from various publicly available repositories and clean samples paired with poisoned samples were analyzed.

methodology.calculation: Measures the proportional success rates of the generated outputs based on specified prompts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores on pass@k indicate better performance of the generated HDL code.
methodology.validation: The framework was validated through multiple case studies focusing on different backdoor attack mechanisms.

harm: Code generation vulnerabilities due to backdoor attacks
